|ram1=4 |ram1_brand=EliteMT |ram1_model=M12L16161C A9L16 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=DE-9 |wi1_module=Gemtek WL-216C |wi1_module_if=PCMCIA (16-bit) |wi1_chip1_brand=Harris |wi1_chip1_model=HFA3841 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3861B |wi1_chip3_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3683A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn=MMCX |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=ASIX |eth_chip2_model=AX88796 |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8305S |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=Wireless |default_ssid_regex=^Wireless$ |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass= |oui=00:03:0A |oui_eth=00:03:0A |default_ch= }} [http://web.archive.org/web/20060521052527/http://www.router.adso.com.pl/EW2104ds.pdf Datasheet (via archive.org)], [http://web.archive.org/web/20050909170633/http://www.router.adso.com.pl/EW2104m.pdf Manual (via archive.org)]
This device actually uses a 10/100 Ethernet controller for the WAN, unlike almost all other S3C4510x based routers from this era.
This device uses a '''EPIC''' Ei16C550 (Ei16C550-CJ44) FIFO UART to provide for the DE-9 serial port on the back of the unit.
This device uses an '''Altera''' EPM3032ALC44-10 ([http://www.altera.com/literature/ds/m3000a.pdf MAX 3000A PLD]).
"AGS200117" and "Ver: 1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. "GEMTEK", "2100700801", and "WL-216" is silkscreened on the wireless module.
This router was also sold as the.. *[[Hawking WR254S]] (OUI: 00:03:0A ['''Argus Technologies'''])
The manual shows the sample value in the ESSID field to be '''Wireless'''. As this SSID is very common with the 00:03:0A ('''Argus Technologies''') OUI, it can (probably) be safely assumed that the default SSID of the device is indeed '''Wireless'''.
